column2: NEVADA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. This road sign means:
2. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
3. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
4. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column6: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column8: turning right on red is forbidden.

column2: 5. __________ limit(s) your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
column4: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit
column6: Even the smallest amount of alcohol
column8: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05

column2: 6. Which shape is a warning sign?
7. What do warning signs mean?
column6: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.
column8: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.

column2: 8. Speed limit signs are:
9. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column6: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column8: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column10: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.

column2: 10. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column6: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column8: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 11. When the road is slippery, you should:
column6: use your emergency or parking brake.
column8: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.

column2: 12. When driving near light rail vehicles, drivers should:
column4: never drive around lowered crossing gates.
column6: expect trains on any track at any time.
column8: always obey signs and traffic signals.

column2: 13. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column8: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.

column2: 14. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: exceed the posted speed limit when driving on expressways.
column8: share the lane with another vehicle.
column10: ride side-by-side in a single lane.

column2: 15. After stopping for a school bus that is unloading children you should:
column10: watch for children walking along the side of the road.

column2: 16. A flashing red traffic light:
column4: is used to indicate a pedestrian crossing.
column6: indicates that you should drive with caution.
column8: has the same meaning as a stop sign.
column10: has the same meaning as a yield sign.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
18. When parked facing down hill, your wheels should be turned:
19. This is:
20. A speed restriction sign:
column6: must be ignored in snow conditions.
column8: shows the recommended speed for a curve/turn.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column6: All traffic must turn right at next intersection
column8: Right turn on red light permitted

column2: 22. When driving on major highways you should:
column4: be ready to react to road hazards.

column2: 23. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column4: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 24. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:
column4: accelerate to the speed of traffic.
column6: stop first, then gradually enter traffic.
column8: drive above the speed of traffic to get ahead.
column10: enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.

column2: 25. This sign means drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.
column6: proceed at normal speed through the upcoming intersection.
column10: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road they wish to enter.

column2: 26. This sign is used to warn drivers about:
27. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column10: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 28. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column6: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.

column2: 29. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column6: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.
column10: they already are within the intersection.

column2: 30. This sign indicates:
31. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must go to the next intersection.
column8: must turn into its left lane.
column10: must turn into its right lane.

column2: 32. This sign indicates:
33. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
34. When approaching someone using a white cane, you should proceed with caution because:
column6: the pedestrian might be using a guide dog.

column2: 35. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column6: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 36. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column8: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
38. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: stop and wait for the light to change.
column6: proceed with caution through the intersection.
column8: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.
column10: speed up to beat the red light.

column2: 39. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column6: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column8: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.

column2: 40. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
column8: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.

column2: 41. Arrows on the roadway:
column4: show which lanes you must use.
column6: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.

column2: 42. This sign means:
column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 43. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
44. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column6: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column8: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

column2: 45. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column4: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.

column2: 46. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column6: to turn on your windshield wipers.
column8: to look for road edge markings to guide you.

column2: 47. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column8: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column10: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.

column2: 48. Parking is not allowed:
column8: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 49. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: use only one hand on the wheel.
column8: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column10: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.

column2: 50. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column10: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.
